events.title: Prompt to Image ‚Äì AI Creativity Competition
events.description:
## Introduction

Artificial Intelligence is reshaping creative expression, with **prompt engineering** emerging as a crucial skill that connects human intent with AI-generated outcomes. Designing effective prompts is now an essential competency for students engaging with modern AI tools.

The **Computer Engineering Innovation and Tech Club (CITC), NCIT** presents **"Prompt to Image"**, an AI-based creativity competition that challenges participants to transform structured textual prompts into compelling visual outputs. The event emphasizes creativity, storytelling, and ethical AI usage over technical complexity.

---

## Event Overview

Participants are provided with a standardized **prompt framework** containing predefined blank spaces. By creatively completing the framework, participants generate a meaningful paragraph that serves as the final prompt for AI-based image generation.

This format ensures:
- Equal creative opportunity for all participants  
- Strong focus on prompt engineering and storytelling  
- Emphasis on originality and human intent

Each participant submits:
- A completed prompt paragraph  
- One AI-generated image  
- A brief concept explanation

---

## Eligibility

- Open to all students of **Nepal College of Information Technology (NCIT)**  
- **Individual participation only**

---

## Competition Structure

The competition is conducted in **two phases**:

**Phase-I (Online Round):**
Participants submit their completed prompt and AI-generated image online. Entries are evaluated by judges along with public engagement. The **Top 10 participants** qualify for the final round.

**Phase-II (Physical Final Round):**
Finalists compete physically at **NCIT**, where a new prompt framework is provided on the spot. Participants generate AI images live, followed by judge-based evaluation.

---

## Evaluation Overview

Evaluation focuses on creativity, prompt quality, visual coherence, concept clarity, and ethical AI use. Phase-I includes both judges‚Äô evaluation and public engagement, while Phase-II is primarily judge-based.

*Detailed rules and evaluation criteria are available in the official Rule Book.*

---

## Important Dates

- **Phase-I Submission Period:** 18th January ‚Äì 25th January, 00:00 NPT  
- **Phase-II Schedule:** To be announced via CITC platforms

---

## Prizes & Recognition

- üèÜ **Winner:** NPR 3,000 + Certificate & Medal  
- ü•à **Runner-Up:** NPR 2,000 + Certificate & Medal  
- ü•â **Second Runner-Up:** NPR 1,000 + Certificate & Medal  

Digital certificates will be provided to all participants.

---

## Rule Book

All participants must read and follow the **Participants Rule Book**, which contains detailed guidelines, submission rules, ethical policies, and evaluation criteria.

---

## Contact & Support

For queries or clarifications:

or reach out through **CITC official social media platforms**
